title: Labour says it is ‘deplorable’ for Reform to dismiss Farage schoolboy racism claims as lies – UK politics live
summary: Reform UK deputy leader Richard Tice defended Nigel Farage, dismissing allegations against him as "nonsense." Tice suggested that the claims are driven by individuals with "a political axe to grind." The remarks indicate Tice's support for Farage amid ongoing criticisms.

title: Australia v England: Ashes second Test, Joe Root hits century on day one – live
summary: The Ashes series continues with a day-night Test match in Brisbane. Live updates and commentary are being provided by writers covering the event. Fans can follow the action as it unfolds.

title: Number of flu patients in England’s hospitals up 56% on a year ago
summary: Last week, hospitals reported an average of 1,717 patients hospitalized due to a flu outbreak. The flu season has begun unusually early this year and has not yet reached its peak. Health officials are monitoring the situation closely as cases continue to rise.

title: German chancellor warns leaders that decisions they make now on Ukraine will ‘decide the future of Europe’ – live
summary: Merz intervenes amidst conflicting views on the Ukraine conflict, with Putin acknowledging that peace talks are challenging. Meanwhile, Trump asserts that the Russian president is interested in reaching a deal. This highlights the stark differences in perspectives on the possibility of resolving the conflict.

title: Budget uncertainty blamed for plunge in UK construction output, and investor exodus from the stock market – business live
summary: There is ongoing coverage of recent developments in the economy and financial markets. Key trends and updates are being monitored closely as they unfold. Analysts are focusing on factors impacting economic stability and market performance.
